newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish Maersk Air rejects KLM overtures.
newsitem.headline: Danish Maersk Air rejects KLM overtures.

text.p: Denmark's Maersk Air on Monday rejected overtures for closer cooperation from the newly announced strategic alliance between Norwegian airline Braathens SAFE and KLM Royal Dutch Airline .
"I still think that it is the best thing for Maersk Air to be independent, to have many allies and not be tied to one partner," Maersk Air managing director Bjarne Hansen told Reuters.
"If you tie yourself down in one strategic alliance, you prevent cooperation with other companies and we are not interested in that," he said.
Earlier Braathens SAFE and KLM announced that they planned to form a strategic alliance and offered closer cooperation with Finland's Finnair and Maersk.

Maersk Air, owned by the Danish A.P. Moeller shipping and energy group, launched eight-times daily flights between Stockholm and Copenhagen last April in cooperation with Finnair in a challenge to Scandinavian Airlines System (SAS).
The deregulation of air traffic has meant increased pressure on SAS on its home territory in Scandinavia from outside as well as regional airlines.
